question: If A and B together can complete a piece of work in 15 days and B alone in 20 days, then in how many days can A alone complete the work ?
explanation:
(A + B)\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{15}&s=1$
B\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{20}&s=1$
∴ A\'s 1 day\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{15}-\\frac{1}{20} = \\frac{4-3}{60}= \\frac{1}{60}&s=1$
∴ A alone will do the work in 60 days.
Hence option [D] is correct answer.
